systemDescription.name: Vehicle Status Display System
systemDescription.description: The Vehicle Status Display system in the IVI presents critical vehicle information to the driver including speed, fuel level, temperature, warning notifications, and system status. It integrates with multiple vehicle systems to collect, process, and display real-time information in a user-friendly format designed for at-a-glance comprehension.
operatingConditions: Various lighting conditions from direct sunlight to night

safetyGoals.description: The Vehicle Status Display shall present accurate and timely critical vehicle information to the driver
safetyGoals.rationale: Inaccurate or delayed critical vehicle information could lead to unsafe driving decisions or vehicle operation

decomposedRequirements.description: The IVI system shall display accurate vehicle speed information with minimal delay
The IVI system shall display critical warning notifications within specified time constraints
The IVI system shall verify the integrity of displayed vehicle status information

safetyGoals.description: The Vehicle Status Display shall present information in a clear, unambiguous manner that minimizes driver distraction
safetyGoals.rationale: Cluttered or confusing vehicle status information could cause prolonged driver attention and distraction

decomposedRequirements.description: The IVI system shall implement display formats that enable at-a-glance comprehension
The IVI system shall prioritize and filter vehicle status information based on criticality
The IVI system shall adapt display characteristics to various environmental conditions

hazardAnalysis.operationalSituation: Vehicle in motion in speed-limited zone
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Driver exceeds speed limit due to incorrect speed display

hazardAnalysis.operationalSituation: Vehicle in motion in complex traffic situation
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Driver attention diverted for excessive time to interpret display

hazardAnalysis.description: Delayed or missing critical warning display
hazardAnalysis.operationalSituation: Vehicle in motion with developing critical condition
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Driver unaware of critical vehicle condition requiring immediate action

hazardAnalysis.description: Poor display visibility in extreme lighting
hazardAnalysis.operationalSituation: Vehicle in motion in direct sunlight or night conditions
hazardAnalysis.hazardousEvent: Driver unable to read critical vehicle information

item.name: Vehicle Status Display System
item.function: Display critical vehicle information to driver

failureEffects.local: Displayed speed differs from actual vehicle speed
failureEffects.nextLevel: Driver operates vehicle based on incorrect speed information
failureEffects.endEffect: Potential traffic violation or unsafe driving condition

detection: Cross-check speed data from multiple sources

mitigations.description: Redundant speed data processing with cross-validation
Speed value plausibility checking with error indication

safetyRequirements.description: The Vehicle Status Display shall implement cross-validation of speed data from at least two independent sources
The Vehicle Status Display shall indicate display uncertainty when speed data sources disagree by more than 3 km/h

potentialCauses: Too many status items displayed simultaneously

failureEffects.local: Status display requires extended viewing to comprehend
failureEffects.nextLevel: Driver must focus on display for excessive time
failureEffects.endEffect: Increased risk of collision due to distraction

mitigations.description: Dynamic information prioritization based on driving context

safetyRequirements.description: The Vehicle Status Display shall limit simultaneously displayed information items to no more than 7 when vehicle is in motion
The Vehicle Status Display shall implement context-based information prioritization that adapts to driving conditions

failureEffects.nextLevel: Driver receives critical information too late
failureEffects.endEffect: Insufficient time for driver to respond to critical condition

prevention: Implement dedicated processing path for critical warnings
Prioritize warning message traffic on communication buses

mitigations.description: High-priority processing path for critical warning messages
Redundant warning paths for critical systems

safetyRequirements.description: The Vehicle Status Display shall present critical warnings within 200ms of detection
The Vehicle Status Display shall implement dedicated processing resources for critical warning messages

failureModes.description: Poor display visibility in extreme lighting conditions
potentialCauses: Poor contrast ratio in direct sunlight

failureEffects.local: Display information difficult or impossible to read
failureEffects.nextLevel: Driver unable to obtain critical vehicle information
failureEffects.endEffect: Unsafe vehicle operation due to information deficit

detection: Test display readability in various lighting

mitigations.description: Adaptive contrast and color schemes based on ambient lighting
Redundant critical information display with different technology

safetyRequirements.description: The Vehicle Status Display shall maintain minimum contrast ratio of 7:1 for critical information under all lighting conditions
The Vehicle Status Display shall automatically adjust brightness and contrast based on ambient light conditions

safetyMechanisms.mechanism: Cross-validation of speed information from multiple sources
safetyMechanisms.implementationDetails: System compares speed data from at least two independent sources (wheel speed sensors, GPS, transmission) and flags discrepancies exceeding 3 km/h
System dynamically adjusts displayed information based on vehicle status, speed, and driving conditions to minimize distraction

safetyMechanisms.mechanism: Dedicated processing channel for critical warnings
safetyMechanisms.implementationDetails: System implements high-priority processing path for critical warnings with guaranteed maximum latency of 200ms from detection to display
System continuously measures ambient light conditions and adjusts brightness, contrast, color schemes to maintain readability
System implements checksum verification for display content and performs periodic validation of critical information accuracy

testCases.testProcedure: Compare displayed speed with reference speed measurement at various speeds
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Displayed speed accurate within ±2 km/h or indication of uncertainty when sources disagree

testCases.description: Verify speed display with corrupted data
testCases.testProcedure: Inject corrupted speed data and observe system response
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: System indicates uncertainty when speed data sources disagree by more than 3 km/h

testCases.testProcedure: Generate multiple status events and measure display content density
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: No more than 7 information items displayed simultaneously when in motion

testCases.testProcedure: Test display content in various driving scenarios
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Information prioritization adapts appropriately to different driving contexts

testCases.testProcedure: Measure end-to-end latency for critical warning display
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Critical warnings displayed within 200ms of detection

testCases.testProcedure: Analyze system architecture and test warning processing under high system load
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Critical warnings processed with dedicated resources unaffected by system load

testCases.description: Verify display contrast in bright conditions
testCases.testProcedure: Test display readability under simulated bright sunlight
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Critical information maintains minimum 7:1 contrast ratio in all lighting conditions

testCases.testProcedure: Test display adaptation under changing light conditions
testCases.acceptanceCriteria: Display automatically adjusts brightness and contrast within 2 seconds of lighting change
